Alcor6L is a simple-to-use multi-language interactive programming environment that runs on a variety of embedded hardware devices.

It runs programs in:
* Lua using [http://eluaproject.net eLua]
* C using PicoC
* Lisp using PicoLisp
and in development:
* BASIC using MY-BASIC
* Scheme using TinyScheme 
* Forth
on cheap 32-bit single-board computers:
* The [http://simplemachines.it/mizar32 Mizar32] models A and B by simplemachines.it, available from [http://4star.it 4star.it]
* LM3S and STM32 ARM boards 

The source code is available from: http://github.com/simplemachines-italy/Alcor6L

Compiled firmware images can be downloaded from: http://simplemachines.it/downloads/Alcor6L

and it has a mailing list at http://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/alcor6l

This wikibook is a work-in progress to produce its reference manual and tutorial.
